results.title: [Australian olympic team visits Bayer works at Leverkusen on June 22nd 1936]
results.brief_description: Documentary from 1936 about the visit of the Australian Olympic team to the Bayer Works, manufacturers of Bayer Aspirins and APC powders, at Leverkusen, near Cologne, Germany before travelling to Berlin for the Olympic Games. The Australian Olympic team are shown arriving in Cologne, Germany, and being met by representatives of the Bayer works. They move on to a casino where they have breakfast. The team’s chaperone, Mrs. Ferguson talks to long distance runner, Daryl Backhouse. At the Bayer Works factory team members Alf Watson and Pat Norton look at a machine which fills and caps vials. The team moves on and looks at a machine which makes Bayer aspirins. At a dock on the Rhine river, where raw materials for the factory are unloaded, team members L. Cook, Duncan Gray and Bill Dixson are shown standing around and chatting. After a visit to the factory the team are shown sight seeing around Cologne. Shots of a booklet signing are followed by shots of Berlin. As the Australian team disembark from their train on their arrival at a railway station in Berlin, the German Navy are shown playing ‘God save the King’ on the station’s platform. Words of the sound film are spoken by Mr. Alderson, manager of the Australian Olympic team.

results.title: [Arthur Rubinstein]
results.brief_description: Biographical documentary about world-renowned classical pianist, Arthur Rubinstein. Born in Poland in 1887, Rubinstein first visited America in 1906, playing in Philadelphia and New York. However he finally settled in Paris until 1914 when he offered his services to the British authorities as an interpreter during the period of the war. At the end of the war he returned to America performing at numerous concerts between 1919 and 1927, but it would take until 1937 before Rubinstein finally gained full recognition. Eventually settling in Hollywood he became one of the most prolific recording and concert artists, collaborating frequently with Jascha Heifetz and Gregor Piatigorsky as part of the “Million Dollar Trio”. He died in Geneva in 1982 leaving a legacy of a multitude of television and motion picture musical scores composed over a thirty-year period. This film features interviews and performances by Rubinstein, David Oistrakj, and the Million Dollar Trio. NB: Quality of picture and sound is inconsistent.

results.title: [Aran Spottiswood]
results.brief_description:
A Fibbert crab comes to life by eating the stamp that it is enclosed in and proceeds to swim out to a blue sea.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: [Aquarius: Peter Hall - Director etc.]
results.brief_description: In this film about Peter Hall, his work and life are relayed — by the man himself. This profile of the theatre and film director was conducted on the eve of taking over as director of London’s Royal Opera House.

results.title: [Animated orchestral cartoon by Walter Lantz]
results.brief_description: An animated musical which captures the festive antics of a group of farmyard animals playing a musical symphony using farm objects as instruments. The music gradually builds to a frenzied peak as birds and animals interfere with the conductor’s baton.

results.title: [Anatomy of the hand] (D)
results.brief_description: Dissection of a human hand and arm showing the functional anatomy of the hand. Identifies the nerves and tendons responsible for the movement of the hand and its individual fingers. Presents the procedures and precautions necessary for hand surgery.

results.title: [Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 8]
results.brief_description:
This film is a continuation from Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 7

This film begins with the introduction of the Baining people. The Baining people are the original inhabitants of the Gazelle Peninsula of East New Britain. According to Albert Drayton the people had just been brought out from the mountains as part of the missionary work.

Numerous ceremonies are seen in this film including a wedding, dances, spear throwing and a mock battle.

The later part of the film is the return to Australia briefly visiting Brisbane and Sydney before returning to Melbourne.

Both deck quoits and deck tennis are seen being played on the ship.

There are scenes of the Sydney Harbour bridge, the Sydney Railway station and Town hall.

The film finishes with the Drayton family in Melbourne.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:03:00 – Missionary Grounds and local huts

00:00:31:00 – Footage of the Baining people with women weaving thread and stocking the fire

00:01:08:00 – Performances for the tourists including a marriage ceremony, Tower dance and spear throwing, a ceremonial dance, a mock battle and a victory dance

00:06:05:00 – Mt Drayton with one of the chiefs

00:06:09:00 – Performance with men wearing large decorative head gear supported with string controlled by the women

00:07:23:00 – Baining man with baby

00:07:36:00 – Masks and head pieces being given as a gift to the missionary cruise

00:08:15:00 – Cruise passengers packed into the ship deck on journey back from Papua New Guinea

00:08:48:00 – Cruise Passengers with the ship’s captain and Mr Dennis, the mayor of Northcote, Melbourne

00:09:18:00 – Passengers playing Quoits on the deck of the ship

00:10:11:00 – Views of Sydney Harbour Bridge with Harold Drayton and an Electric Train

00:10:45:00 – Sydney Central Railway Station and Town Hall with street view of traffic officer directing traffic

00:11:34:00 – Mavis, unidentified woman and Mrs Drayton

00:12:36:00 – Drayton family and passengers playing Deck Quoits and Tennis

00:13:26:00 – Albert Drayton and mother unpacking the car at Hampshire Road, Melbourne

00:13:35:00 - Mavis, unknown, Harold, Roy, Albert, unknown, Mrs Drayton (mother)

00:13:45:00 – Members of the Drayton family posing with gifts including Roy, Harold, Albert, Ted Drayton and Mother

00:14:34:00 – Peter (Mavis’s son) crawling to his aeroplane

results.title: [Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 6]
results.brief_description:
Much of this film contains scenes of landscape in Alice Springs including the Standley Chasm.

There are a few different modes of transport seen throughout such as a 1956 Austin Healey, the Ghan locomotive, a bus owned by the Tuit’s coach services and horses.

Also shown is the John Flynn Memorial Church and Adelaide House, Alice Springs, the first hospital which was created by John Flynn.

Of interest for Aboriginal heritage is a few scenes of local Aboriginal men working on a tractor and Aboriginal horsemen.

The film finishes with a scene of the Drayton Home in Melbourne.

Selected hightlights list:
00:00:02:00 - Train carriage carrying a 1956 Austin Healey 100

00:00:12:00 – Old Ghan locomotive at the Old Ghan Heritage Railway and Museum Alice Springs

00:00:38:00 - Alice Springs, John Flynn Memorial Uniting Church

00:00:51:00 - Adelaide House, Alice Springs

00:00:59:00 – Two Aboriginal men working on a tractor

00:02:25:00 – Passengers exiting the bus – Tuit’s Coach Services

00:03:49:00 – Anzac Hill Memorial lookout - Alice Springs

00:05:10:00 – Scenic – Rocky hills on the way towards Standley Chasm, Alice Springs

00:06:57:00 – Standley Chasm

00:10:21:00 – Unknown saleswoman in a shop

00:10:25:00 – Cattle yard with cattle coming off a train carriage with 1954 Ford Mainline Utility in view

00:10:47:00 – tourists taking photos of Aboriginal horsemen

00:13:50:00 – Scenic reflection in a Puddle

results.title: [Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 5]
results.brief_description:
This film follows the Drayton family on a Methodist missionary cruise to Papua New Guinea.

It begins in Sydney Harbour upon a passenger ship with a streamer farewell and continues with a visit to Stony Creek Falls and the Forest Gardens, Karunda before heading to Kwato and later Raboul, Papua New Guinea.

There are scenes of the Stony Creek train, bridge and falls as well as the Barron Falls.

In Kwato, there are many scenes of local men, women and children going about their daily activities including the making of Sago.

In Robaul, the tourists are treated to local celebration with music, costume and dance.

There a few scenes with boats, ships and canoes from Papa New Guinea including a canoe race.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:02:00 – Ship departure from Sydney dock with crowds and streamers

00:01:50:00 – Overflow Train and carriage Kuranda with Mr and Mrs Drayton and Ted Drayton

00:02:16:00 – Stony Creek Falls with tourists on the bridge and train. Stony Creek, Cairns

00:02:58:00 – Barron Falls, Cairns

00:03:34:00 – Mr and Mrs Drayton, unknown woman and Harold Drayton in the Rain Forest Gardens, Karanda

00:03:49:00 – Albert Drayton and sister Mavis in the Rain Forest Gardens, Karanda

00:06:18:00 – Jack Wallis, Mrs Drayton, Mr Webster and Mr Drayton, Kwato

00:06:23:00 – Mr Drayton with Local Men, Kwato

00:06:46:00 – locals making Sago, building a boat and weaving, Kwato

00:07:33:00 – Reverend Wesley Amos and son drinking from coconuts

00:07:52:00 – Mr and Mrs Drayton with a group of local kids singing, Kwato

00:08:37:00 – Mavis in canoe with two local men, Kwato

00:09:21:00 – Missionary Choir, Kwato

00:09:38:00 – Canoe Race - Kwato

00:10:01:00 – Albert Drayton and locals, Kwato

00:10:33:00 – Raboul, New Guinea showing the Mission House, a local policeman and locals dressed in tradition garments ready for performance

00:11:24:00 – Traditional dance and musicians playing percussion, Raboul

00:12:37:00 – Closeup of one of the headdresses, Raboul

00:12:59:00 – After ceremony, bringing of gifts members of the cruise including live birds on a stick. Raboul

results.title: [Albert Drayton Home Movies: Reel 4]
results.brief_description:
Most of this film looks at the streets of Melbourne during the 1954 Royal visit of Queen Elizabeth and the decorations that adorn them. It includes parades in the streets of Essendon and the Queens visit to the Essendon Airport. It also includes the children’s performance to the Queen at the MCG.

It shows many buildings and businesses which no longer exist and others with the original signage including the Tivoli building on Swanston Street, Leviathan Swanson Clothes and the Odeon, H.V. McKay Pty Ltd, Showroom in Sunshine and Mitchell farm machinery in Footscray.

Melbourne businesses include Ball and Welch Pty Ltd. Department store, Snows Department store, State Electricity Commission, Foy’s department store, Darrod’s Department store, Treadway’s Department store, Georges Department store, Buckley and Nunn Emporium, Millege Bros Motor Cycles and Myer.

There is a brief scene of 139 Colins Street which at the time housed the Alexander Club which ran between 1917 – 1983. An exclusive club for wealthy women.

Many forms of transport can be seen including cars, trucks, Melbourne trams and the passenger liner, Gothic, seen in the harbour.

Fashion of the 1950s is also seen throughout.

Selected highlights list:
00:00:21:00 – The Queen and Prince Phillip drive passed in a Humber Super Snipe - Mount Alexander Road

00:00:50:00 – Crowd member uses an old periscope box to see the Queen - Mount Alexander Road

00:01:49:00 – Eve Drayton, Lynette and Roncavel at the car

00:01:56:00 – Drayton Refractories adorned for royal visit Market Road

00:02:08:00 – Queen and Prince Phillip drive past in a Daimler Landaulette – Napier Street bridge

00:03:44:00 – Girls playing with tricycle and pram – Fashion

00:03:50:00 – Queen departing Melbourne Aboard a RAF DC3 fighter plane Essendon Airport

00:05:27:00 – Gothic. A passenger ship in Port Melbourne harbour which the Queen arrived on

00:05:54 – Streets of Melbourne adorned with decorations for the Royal Visit

00:06:11:00 – Flinders street Station adorned for Royal visit

00:09:37:00 – MCG children display for the Royal visit

00:12:22:00 – Drayton family (and friends) at Maroondah Dam Reservoir park - Healesville

00:13:22:00 – Albert and Eva Drayton’s wedding day. (13th December 1941) (extreme left Jock Hider - Best man, Connie Hill, Harold and Gladys)

00:14:23:00 –Eva and parents at family house

00:14:37:00 – Drayton Family posing and dancing - Eva’s Mother and Father, Auntie Edith, Mr Drayton, Eddie, Roy, Albert Drayton, Wesley

00:15:11:00 – Drayton family outside the family home
